thread.title: SMU quick hits: Mustangs' offense improves on third down; WR's homecoming a success
thread.title_full: SMU quick hits: Mustangs' offense improves on third down; WR's homecoming a success | Dallas Morning News

author: Bill Nichols
title: SMU quick hits: Mustangs' offense improves on third down; WR's homecoming a success
text:
Chad Pursley made his second straight start at left tackle for SMU. The redshirt freshman beat out junior Chauncey Briggs, but coach Chad Morris said they are locked in a tight competition. "The door opened up for him, he took advantage of it and he doesn't want to give it up," Morris said. "It's a daily competition. That's when you know you're getting better, when you've got guys competing at every spot."
The Mustangs were intent on improving their third-down performance after converting only 2-of-14 attempts in last week's loss to East Carolina. They converted their first six in taking a 14-7 lead. Their second drive produced third-down gains of 17 yards by Prescott Line, Shelby Walkers' 33-yard reception and Ryheem Malone's 9-yard touchdown catch.
SMU WR Ryheem Malone came up big in his return to his hometown. The sophomore from Houston Bellaire caught a 9-yard touchdown pass from Matt Davis for a 14-7 lead with 5:24 left in the first quarter. Malone played in five games last season after transferring from Houston, making five catches. He entered Thursday's game as SMU's second-leading receiver with 13 catches for 163 yards and one TD.
Greg Ward scored on a one-yard keeper around left end to give Houston a 28-21 with two seconds left in the first half. Ward surpassed Case Keenum on the school's all-time list for rushing touchdowns in one season for a quarterback with 10.
After catching a touchdown pass in each of SMU's first four games, Courtland Sutton ended his streak last week against East Carolina. Sutton, though, opened the scoring by catching an eight-yard touchdown pass from Matt Davis.
Houston 49, SMU 28: Complete coverage
